column4: ok i figured out it just isnt for codecs... when i open ADD/ REMOVE and try clicking on anything I get this error message | The list of applications is not availabe
Click on 'Reload' to load it. To reload the list you need a working internet connection.
anything i click on on Add/Remove programs gives me this error | The list of applications is not availabe
Click on 'Reload' to load it. To reload the list you need a working internet connection.
what do u mean?? sorry i dont understand
yes close add and remove, open up synaptic and click on reload
yes, once it reloads you can search for the codecs.
what codecs are you trying to install?
close any package programs you presently have open
open up a terminal and type the following "sudo aptitude install ubuntu-restricted-extras"
restart your computer. For some reason or another, apt seems to be having an issue connecting to the servers
maybe your sources.lst file got messed up
you can reinstall, it will fix it. however, you can just rewrite it or have someone send you a copy of theirs
